oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Clavulanate-potentiated Amoxycillin
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Bywater, R. J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Beta-lactamase
β-lactamase
amoxycillin
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Beta-lactamase production is the main mechanism of resistance to penicillins such as amoxycillin. The β-lactamases represent a complex group which vary in their preferred substrate. Clavulanic acid is a non-reversible inhibitor of the important β-lactamases, and has been formulated with amoxycillin for combined administration. Absorption characteristics of clavulanic acid are similar to those of amoxycillin, and the combination has properties which make it appear useful in treatment of bacterial disease in animals.
